question_title: What will be NVIDIA's forward guidance in their Q4 FY2026 earnings release? (GAAP Operating Expenses)
summary: NVIDIA's Q4 FY2026 earnings release (Feb 25, 2026) will include forward guidance for Q1 FY2027 GAAP Operating Expenses. Key data: GAAP OpEx actuals have grown ~7.5% QoQ consistently (Q4 FY25: $4.69B → Q1 FY26: $5.03B → Q2: $5.41B → Q3: $5.84B). Guidance has been: Q2 $5.7B, Q3 $5.9B, Q4 $6.7B. The Q4 guidance of $6.7B represents a large 14.7% step-up from Q3 actual, possibly reflecting annual SBC refreshes. Applying 5-8% QoQ growth from the $6.7B Q4 anchor yields ~$7.0-7.2B for Q1 FY27. FY26 opex growth was ~40% YoY; FY27 growth likely moderates to 25-30%, consistent with Q1 FY27 at ~$7.0B (~39% YoY from Q1 FY26's $5.03B). NVIDIA uses clean round numbers in guidance. Central estimate: ~$7.0B.

factors.description: Q4 FY26 GAAP OpEx guidance of $6.7B is the key anchor point - the most recent forward-looking figure from NVIDIA management
Consistent ~7.5% QoQ growth in actual GAAP OpEx over 4 consecutive quarters (Q4 FY25 through Q3 FY26) suggests structural growth trajectory
FY26 full-year opex growth guided at 'high-30% range' - FY27 growth likely moderates to 25-30% range, supporting Q1 FY27 around $7.0-7.2B
The large $6.7B Q4 guidance (14.7% jump from Q3 actual) may include annual SBC grants and year-end adjustments, meaning Q1 FY27 could be relatively flat or even slightly lower than Q4
NVIDIA has consistently guided GAAP OpEx slightly above actuals (Q2: -$287M, Q3: -$61M below guidance), suggesting guidance includes buffer
NVIDIA always uses round numbers for guidance ('approximately $X.X billion'), clustering around $6.8B, $7.0B, $7.2B as most likely values
